page.title: 12RELIGION
page.content: {RELIGION}There are six places of Christian worship in Coggeshall. St.Peter's was built on Church Green in 1450.It is the Parish Church.It was bombed in 1944 and re-built in 1956.It is a large stone building with stained glass windows .St.Nicholas's Chapel was built in 1220 along Abbey Lane.It seats fifty-seven people.The only light is from windows and paraffin lamps.Father David Beeton, Coggeshall's vicar, comes regulary into the school to take an assembly. St Bernard's is a wooden building in Stoneham street.It shares a priest with Kelvedon.The three Non-conformist churches are Baptist, Methodist and United Reform. Most of the churches are used for other purposes,like clubs and playgroup,during the week. The library is on the site of the old Friend's Meeting House.
